issue.title: PageStorage: background version compact for v2 (#6446)

labels.name: size/XXL
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 1000+ lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: cherry-pick-approved
labels.description: Cherry pick PR approved by release team.

issue.body:
This is an automated cherry-pick of #6446

### What problem does this PR solve?

Issue Number: close https://github.com/pingcap/tiflash/issues/6407

Problem Summary:
In the previous version, PageStorage v2 do the in-memory version list compaction when snapshot is released. Because multiple snapshot could be released concurrently, this causes some redundant CPU/memory resources.
What's more, slow-releasing snapshots cause DeltaTree's delta-compact task running slowly. This leads to many ColumnFileTiny remain not compacted and causing OOM.

### What is changed and how it works?

Move the in-memory version list compaction to a background pool that is inited when PS v2 instances are created.

### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [ ] Unit test
- [ ] Integration test
- [x] Manual test (add detailed scripts or steps below)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4865550/206362830-86bc35e2-2c77-4a46-b59b-a7bdb57b0630.png)
- [ ] No code

Side effects

- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more CPU
- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more Memory
- [ ] Breaking backward compatibility

Documentation

- [ ] Affects user behaviors
- [ ] Contains syntax changes
- [ ] Contains variable changes
- [ ] Contains experimental features
- [ ] Changes MySQL compatibility

### Release note

<!-- bugfix or new feature needs a release note -->

```release-note
Fix an issue that causes OOM with high throughput write
```

issue.body:
<!--

Thank you for contributing to TiDB!

PR Title Format:
1. pkg [, pkg2, pkg3]: what's changed
2. *: what's changed

-->

### What problem does this PR solve?
<!--

Please create an issue first to describe the problem.

There MUST be one line starting with "Issue Number:  " and 
linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close #38938 

Problem Summary:

### What is changed and how it works?

Most of the feature is the same as MySQL's, except that:

- A server restart, accounts not reset
- Execution of FLUSH PRIVILEGES. (Starting the server with --skip-grant-tables,  failed-login tracking is working. 
    In this case, the first execution of FLUSH PRIVILEGES accounts not reset.)


### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [x] Unit test
- [ ] Integration test
- [ ] Manual test (add detailed scripts or steps below)
- [ ] No code

Side effects

- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more CPU
- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more Memory
- [ ] Breaking backward compatibility

Documentation

- [ ] Affects user behaviors
- [ ] Contains syntax changes
- [ ] Contains variable changes
- [ ] Contains experimental features
- [ ] Changes MySQL compatibility

### Release note

<!-- compatibility change, improvement, bugfix, and new feature need a release note -->

Please refer to [Release Notes Language Style Guide](https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/release-notes-style-guide.html) to write a quality release note.

```release-note

Support failed-login tracking and temporary account locking for users with `FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS` and/or `PASSWORD_LOCK_TIME`

```

Signed-off-by: Weizhen Wang <wangweizhen@pingcap.com>

<!--

Thank you for contributing to TiDB!

PR Title Format:
1. pkg [, pkg2, pkg3]: what's changed
2. *: what's changed

-->

### What problem does this PR solve?
<!--

linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close #39702

Problem Summary:

### What is changed and how it works?

7 min 53s => 9.32s
(B.T.W, if we don't add error stack on decimal truncate error, the execution time can furthur reduce to 5s)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1420062/206188499-a9d9f54d-3d6d-497e-92e0-9688c3a443f5.png)


Before the change:

```
mysql> insert into t1 (c1) select * from t2;
Query OK, 491520 rows affected, 65535 warnings (7 min 53.87 sec)
Records: 491520  Duplicates: 0  Warnings: 65535
```

After:

```
mysql> insert into t1 (c1) select * from t2;
Query OK, 491520 rows affected, 65535 warnings (9.32 sec)
Records: 491520  Duplicates: 0  Warnings: 65535
```

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

Issue Number: close #39626

### What is changed and how it works?

- The scan range defined to `[start, end)` ,  so modified some implements of sql builder
- Split scan tasks for table with int or binary primary key 

For implement detail, the PR takes some considerations with:

- The region cannot grantee its start/end key is a legal format for table row: #20727. So this PR does some works to parse a legal value of the region edges.
- When a int handle is unsigned, and if a range  is across negative and positive values, we should split this range to two ranges.

issue.body:
Signed-off-by: guo-shaoge <shaoge1994@163.com>

<!--

Thank you for contributing to TiDB!

PR Title Format:
1. pkg [, pkg2, pkg3]: what's changed
2. *: what's changed

-->

### What problem does this PR solve?
<!--

Please create an issue first to describe the problem.

There MUST be one line starting with "Issue Number:  " and 
linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close #34707

Problem Summary: Support dispatch copTask/batchCopTask/mppTask to **tiflash_mpp/tiflash ReadNodes**.

### What is changed and how it works?

For now, there are three types of Task that will be sent to TiFlash. We need to consider all three code paths in two dimension:
1. **Dispatch**: make sure task will only be dispatched to **tiflash_mpp/ReadNode** using consistent hashing.
2. **ErrorHandling**: make sure tiflash_mpp store addr cache is updated when error occurs.

Function changes for each task type of each dimension is as following:
1. copTask:
  1.1. **Dispatch**: [choose tiflash_mpp store when get grpcCtx(in client-go)](https://github.com/tikv/client-go/pull/481/files#diff-0c36d07fbd1fc71c850ff57d323fe12bdf7f2c053ef71b7fec5bb44358f1070dR866).
  1.2. **ErrorHandling**: [onSendFail() in client-go](https://github.com/tikv/client-go/pull/481/files#diff-0c36d07fbd1fc71c850ff57d323fe12bdf7f2c053ef71b7fec5bb44358f1070dR1284).
3. batchCopTask
  2.1. **Dispatch**:  [(*CopClient) sendBatch()](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/pull/33535/files#diff-dec6808c7659579faf2c9c6f9d8b7a7e0d7095b61b9a07cfd2cbc9546a3c7c86R774). Add new storeType parameter.
  2.2. **ErrorHandling**:  [(ss *RegionBatchRequestSender) onSendFailForBatchRegions](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/pull/33535/files#diff-b7e053af55748918c6b51e58c3c4d51e6dd68f7ba3ca915422a5d72d17a71107R102)
4. mppTask
  3.1. **Dispatch**: [(c *MPPClient) ConstructMPPTasks](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/pull/33535/files#diff-3300ba3ff9760189bb4bc2021506c6fe94907d2912cae13a704cf101d2236067R86).
  3.2. **ErrorHandling**: [dispatch mppTask failed](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/pull/33535/files#diff-3300ba3ff9760189bb4bc2021506c6fe94907d2912cae13a704cf101d2236067R309) and [establish mppTask failed](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/pull/33535/files#diff-3300ba3ff9760189bb4bc2021506c6fe94907d2912cae13a704cf101d2236067R382).

A new storeType `kv.TiFlashMPP` is added to help distinguish whether task will only be **dispatch** to ReadNodes or not.
### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [ ] Unit test
- [x] Integration test: 
      1. test-infra E2E case is added: https://github.com/pingcap/endless/pull/657
      2. sqllogic test: https://github.com/pingcap/schrodinger-test/pull/484
- [ ] Manual test (add detailed scripts or steps below)
- [ ] No code

Side effects

- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more CPU
- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more Memory
- [ ] Breaking backward compatibility

Documentation

- [x] Affects user behaviors: `tiflash_mpp` is permited for **tidb_isolation_read_engines**.
- [ ] Contains syntax changes
- [ ] Contains variable changes
- [ ] Contains experimental features
- [ ] Changes MySQL compatibility

### Release note

<!-- bugfix or new feature needs a release note -->

```release-note
*: support disaggregated tiflash
```

<!--

### What problem does this PR solve?
<!--

linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close #xxx

Problem Summary:

### What is changed and how it works?

TransactionCtx is reset every time, so the `shardRand` is re-allocated everytime.
https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/2ca37cb156f95d0d70575ab66b886822efa1e5bd/sessionctx/variable/session.go#L249-L252

```
cd session;
go test -run XXX -bench BenchmarkAutoIncrement -cpuprofile cpu.out -benchtime 20s -benchmem
```

```
BenchmarkAutoIncrement-16    	  182841	    128616 ns/op	   40619 B/op	     428 allocs/op
vs
BenchmarkAutoIncrement-16    	  186334	    118309 ns/op	   35175 B/op	     426 allocs/op
```




Before the change:


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1420062/205850214-5d2154b8-6bbf-476f-8beb-eb1d6e6d7241.png)


After the change:


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1420062/205850025-957f2e1f-11a0-4d0b-9296-15802678575c.png)


### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [ ] Integration test

- [ ] No code

issue.body:
Signed-off-by: joccau <zak.zhao@pingcap.com>

<!--

Thank you for contributing to TiDB!

PR Title Format:
1. pkg [, pkg2, pkg3]: what's changed
2. *: what's changed

-->

### What problem does this PR solve?
<!--

Please create an issue first to describe the problem.

There MUST be one line starting with "Issue Number:  " and 
linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/issues/39602

Problem Summary:
The restoring data is gc when pitr. because the process of applying kv-events is concurrent and the kv-events is not sorted by tso.

### What is changed and how it works?
- Disable gc when pitr by set config tikv `gc.ratio-threshold`= -1.0

### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [x] Unit test
- [ ] Integration test
- [x] Manual test (add detailed scripts or steps below)
- [ ] No code

### Manual tesst
1. During PITR 
```
MySQL [(none)]> show config where name = 'gc.ratio-threshold';
+------+-------------------+--------------------+-------+
| Type | Instance          | Name               | Value |
+------+-------------------+--------------------+-------+
| tikv | 172.16.6.47:13460 | gc.ratio-threshold | -1    |
| tikv | 172.16.6.35:3460  | gc.ratio-threshold | -1    |
| tikv | 172.16.6.35:13460 | gc.ratio-threshold | -1    |
| tikv | 172.16.6.46:13460 | gc.ratio-threshold | -1    |
| tikv | 172.16.6.46:3460  | gc.ratio-threshold | -1    |
| tikv | 172.16.6.47:3460  | gc.ratio-threshold | -1    |
+------+-------------------+--------------------+-------+
```
2. finish PITR
```
MySQL [(none)]> show config where name = 'gc.ratio-threshold';
+------+-------------------+--------------------+-------+
| Type | Instance          | Name               | Value |
+------+-------------------+--------------------+-------+
| tikv | 172.16.6.47:3460  | gc.ratio-threshold | 1.1   |
| tikv | 172.16.6.47:13460 | gc.ratio-threshold | 1.1   |
| tikv | 172.16.6.35:3460  | gc.ratio-threshold | 1.1   |
| tikv | 172.16.6.35:13460 | gc.ratio-threshold | 1.1   |
| tikv | 172.16.6.46:13460 | gc.ratio-threshold | 1.1   |
| tikv | 172.16.6.46:3460  | gc.ratio-threshold | 1.1   |
+------+-------------------+--------------------+-------+
```
3.  admin check table after PITR finished
```
MySQL [(none)]> admin check table flashback.user_data1;
Query OK, 0 rows affected (1.61 sec)
```

Side effects

- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more CPU
- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more Memory
- [ ] Breaking backward compatibility

Documentation

- [ ] Affects user behaviors
- [ ] Contains syntax changes
- [ ] Contains variable changes
- [ ] Contains experimental features
- [ ] Changes MySQL compatibility

### Release note

<!-- compatibility change, improvement, bugfix, and new feature need a release note -->

Please refer to [Release Notes Language Style Guide](https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/release-notes-style-guide.html) to write a quality release note.

```release-note
Disable GC when restore log(PITR) and Enable GC when finish PITR.
```

What's Changed:

<!--

You could use "commit message" code block to add more description to the final commit message.
For more info, check https://github.com/tikv/tikv/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#format-of-the-commit-message.

-->
```commit-message
Update lock wait info after acquiring locks, so that in case there is resumable pessimistic lock requests that's waiting in TiKV, the latest waiting relationship can be used to provide the diagnostic information and do deadlock detection.
```

issue.body:
Signed-off-by: hillium <yu745514916@live.com>

<!--

Thank you for contributing to TiDB!

PR Title Format:
1. pkg [, pkg2, pkg3]: what's changed
2. *: what's changed

-->

### What problem does this PR solve?
<!--

Please create an issue first to describe the problem.

There MUST be one line starting with "Issue Number:  " and 
linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close #39688 

Problem Summary:
We clear the subscription error before canceling the subscription, once there are some errors emitted during canceling, there would be a error-retry loop.

### What is changed and how it works?
This PR:
- Make subscriptions don't emit error when meeting `Status(codes.Canceled, _)`.
- Clear the error after canceling current subscription.

### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [x] Unit test

### Release note

<!-- compatibility change, improvement, bugfix, and new feature need a release note -->

Please refer to [Release Notes Language Style Guide](https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/release-notes-style-guide.html) to write a quality release note.

```release-note
Fixed a bug that may cause TiDB send unexpected unnecessary requests to TiKV.
```

-->

Issue Number: close #39723

Problem Summary:

I made the wrong assumption on the arguments of `TryGetHandleRestoredDataWrapper`. 

Actually, the `row []types.Datum` must have the length of all columns in a table.

### What is changed and how it works?

- Refactor `TryGetHandleRestoredDataWrapper` and correct the usage.
- Add a recover function to prevent TiDB exiting directly on error.
- Add two integration tests.

Signed-off-by: zhanggaoming <gaoming.zhang@pingcap.com>

<!--

Thank you for contributing to TiDB!

PR Title Format:
1. pkg [, pkg2, pkg3]: what's changed
2. *: what's changed

-->

### What problem does this PR solve?
<!--

Please create an issue first to describe the problem.

There MUST be one line starting with "Issue Number:  " and 
linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close #39692

Problem Summary:


### What is changed and how it works?
Fix integration test cases with `--with-sys-table`.

### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [x] Unit test
- [x] Integration test
- [x] Manual test (add detailed scripts or steps below)
- [ ] No code

Side effects

- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more CPU
- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more Memory
- [ ] Breaking backward compatibility

Documentation

- [ ] Affects user behaviors
- [ ] Contains syntax changes
- [ ] Contains variable changes
- [ ] Contains experimental features
- [ ] Changes MySQL compatibility

### Manual test
case 1:
- br backup full
- In restore cluster, execute `alter table mysql.user add column xx int;`
- br restore full
- success

case 2:
- In backup cluster, execute `alter table mysql.user add column xx int;`
- br backup full
- br restore full
- failed, `Error: missing column in cluster data, table: user, col: xx int(11): [BR:Restore:ErrRestoreIncompatibleSys]incompatible system table`


### Release note

<!-- compatibility change, improvement, bugfix, and new feature need a release note -->

Please refer to [Release Notes Language Style Guide](https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/release-notes-style-guide.html) to write a quality release note.

```release-note
None
```

Signed-off-by: crazycs520 <crazycs520@gmail.com>

<!--

Thank you for contributing to TiDB!

PR Title Format:
1. pkg [, pkg2, pkg3]: what's changed
2. *: what's changed

-->

### What problem does this PR solve?
<!--

Please create an issue first to describe the problem.

There MUST be one line starting with "Issue Number:  " and 
linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close #39694

Problem Summary: The default value of `foreign_key_checks` in MySQL is `true`, but TiDB is `false`. Since TiDB already supported foreign key, PM @easonn7 thinks the default value of  `foreign_key_checks` should be consistent with MySQL.

### What is changed and how it works?

### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [x] Unit test
- [x] Integration test
- [ ] Manual test (add detailed scripts or steps below)
- [ ] No code

Side effects

- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more CPU
- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more Memory
- [ ] Breaking backward compatibility

Documentation

- [ ] Affects user behaviors
- [ ] Contains syntax changes
- [ ] Contains variable changes
- [ ] Contains experimental features
- [ ] Changes MySQL compatibility

### Release note

<!-- compatibility change, improvement, bugfix, and new feature need a release note -->

Please refer to [Release Notes Language Style Guide](https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/release-notes-style-guide.html) to write a quality release note.

```release-note
Enable foreign_key_checks variable by default to be consistent with MySQL.
```

What's Changed:

<!--

You could use "commit message" code block to add more description to the final commit message.
For more info, check https://github.com/tikv/tikv/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#format-of-the-commit-message.

-->
```commit-message
Update lock wait info after acquiring locks, so that in case there is resumable pessimistic lock requests that's waiting in TiKV, the latest waiting relationship can be used to provide the diagnostic information and do deadlock detection.
```

issue.body:
Signed-off-by: hillium <yu745514916@live.com>

<!--

Thank you for contributing to TiDB!

PR Title Format:
1. pkg [, pkg2, pkg3]: what's changed
2. *: what's changed

-->

### What problem does this PR solve?
<!--

Please create an issue first to describe the problem.

There MUST be one line starting with "Issue Number:  " and 
linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/issues/39620

Problem Summary:
Sometimes, the receive stream may get stuck when TiKV goes down, and there isn't a timeout for ticking, which may lead to the advancer get stuck, blocking the checkpoint advancing.

### What is changed and how it works?
This PR added a timeout valued `10 * TICK_INTERVAL` for ticking.

### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [x] Unit test

### Release note

<!-- compatibility change, improvement, bugfix, and new feature need a release note -->

Please refer to [Release Notes Language Style Guide](https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/release-notes-style-guide.html) to write a quality release note.

```release-note
Fixed a bug that may cause log backup checkpoint cannot be advanced when some of TiKV down.
```

issue.body:
Signed-off-by: ekexium <eke@fastmail.com>

<!--

Thank you for contributing to TiDB!

PR Title Format:
1. pkg [, pkg2, pkg3]: what's changed
2. *: what's changed

-->

### What problem does this PR solve?
<!--

Please create an issue first to describe the problem.

There MUST be one line starting with "Issue Number:  " and 
linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close #39611

Problem Summary:
The sequence of events that leads to the panic is:
membuffer.set -> enlarge -> onMemChange -> memory tracker decides to panic -> deferred releasing current staging buffer in AddRecord -> revert to last checkpoint

When reverting to last checkpoint, memdb iterates over the nodes backwards, here is why it panics:
The latest block of the arena is in an intermediate state: it is just allocated but no data has been written yet. So its length is 0. While during the iteration we assume the length cannot be 0.

### What is changed and how it works?

Don't let memdb call the callback when the block is in intermediate state. Instead call it after any content is inserted after a new block is allocated.

### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [ ] Unit test
- [ ] Integration test

- [ ] No code

issue.title: ttl: add info schema cache and ttl table status table cache for ttl scheduler

labels.name: status/LGT2
labels.description: Indicates that a PR has LGTM 2.

labels.name: status/can-merge
labels.description: Indicates a PR has been approved by a committer.

labels.name: size/XXL
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 1000+ lines, ignoring generated files.

issue.body:
### What problem does this PR solve?

Issue Number: close #39466

Problem Summary:

To implement a ttl job scheduler, we'll need a local map for info schema and ttl table status, to map from a physical table id to related schema information and the information stored in the ttl table status

### What is changed and how it works?

It does the following changes:

1. Refine the code structure. The sql generator and cache are split and placed in different directories. If we are using sql generator and cache from the manager, both placing them in one level and "reverse (about the folder hierarchy) dependency" is not suggested.
2. Move codes related with session into `ttl/session`, and add an interface of session pool into it (though there are some existing session pool, with the same definition here). I don't know whether it appropriate to add yet another session pool interface (but others are in extensions, br... pkg).
3. Add two struct: `InfoSchemaCache` and the `TTLTableStatusCache`. They are the local mirror of the info schema and `mysql.tidb_ttl_table_status` system table.

This PR relies on https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/pull/39315. Please merge it before this one.

### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [x] Unit test
- [x] Integration test
- [ ] Manual test (add detailed scripts or steps below)
- [ ] No code

## Bug fixes

* Fix the issue that logical operators return wrong results when the argument type is UInt8 [#6127](https://github.com/pingcap/tiflash/issues/6127)

* Fix the issue that heavy write pressure might generate too many column files in the delta layer [#6361](https://github.com/pingcap/tiflash/issues/6361) @[lidezhu](https://github.com/lidezhu)
* Fix the issue that column files in the delta layer cannot be compacted after restarting TiFlash [#6159](https://github.com/pingcap/tiflash/issues/6159) @[lidezhu](https://github.com/lidezhu)

issue.title: PageStorage: background version compact for v2 (#6446)

labels.name: size/XXL

labels.name: cherry-pick-approved
labels.description: Cherry pick PR approved by release team.

issue.body:
This is an automated cherry-pick of #6446

### What problem does this PR solve?

Issue Number: close https://github.com/pingcap/tiflash/issues/6407

Problem Summary:
In the previous version, PageStorage v2 do the in-memory version list compaction when snapshot is released. Because multiple snapshot could be released concurrently, this causes some redundant CPU/memory resources.
What's more, slow-releasing snapshots cause DeltaTree's delta-compact task running slowly. This leads to many ColumnFileTiny remain not compacted and causing OOM.

### What is changed and how it works?

Move the in-memory version list compaction to a background pool that is inited when PS v2 instances are created.

### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [ ] Unit test
- [ ] Integration test
- [x] Manual test (add detailed scripts or steps below)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4865550/206362830-86bc35e2-2c77-4a46-b59b-a7bdb57b0630.png)
- [ ] No code

Side effects

- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more CPU
- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more Memory
- [ ] Breaking backward compatibility

Documentation

- [ ] Affects user behaviors
- [ ] Contains syntax changes
- [ ] Contains variable changes
- [ ] Contains experimental features
- [ ] Changes MySQL compatibility

### Release note

<!-- bugfix or new feature needs a release note -->

```release-note
Fix an issue that causes OOM with high throughput write
```

labels.name: status/LGT2
labels.description: Indicates that a PR has LGTM 2.

labels.description: Indicates a PR has been approved by a committer.

issue.body:
<!--

Thank you for contributing to TiDB!

PR Title Format:
1. pkg [, pkg2, pkg3]: what's changed
2. *: what's changed

-->

### What problem does this PR solve?
<!--

Please create an issue first to describe the problem.

There MUST be one line starting with "Issue Number:  " and 
linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close #38938 

Problem Summary:

### What is changed and how it works?

Most of the feature is the same as MySQL's, except that:

- A server restart, accounts not reset
- Execution of FLUSH PRIVILEGES. (Starting the server with --skip-grant-tables,  failed-login tracking is working. 
    In this case, the first execution of FLUSH PRIVILEGES accounts not reset.)


### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [x] Unit test
- [ ] Integration test
- [ ] Manual test (add detailed scripts or steps below)
- [ ] No code

Side effects

- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more CPU
- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more Memory
- [ ] Breaking backward compatibility

Documentation

- [ ] Affects user behaviors
- [ ] Contains syntax changes
- [ ] Contains variable changes
- [ ] Contains experimental features
- [ ] Changes MySQL compatibility

### Release note

<!-- compatibility change, improvement, bugfix, and new feature need a release note -->

Please refer to [Release Notes Language Style Guide](https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/release-notes-style-guide.html) to write a quality release note.

```release-note

Support failed-login tracking and temporary account locking for users with `FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS` and/or `PASSWORD_LOCK_TIME`

```

<!--

Thank you for contributing to TiDB!

PR Title Format:
1. pkg [, pkg2, pkg3]: what's changed

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close #39702

Problem Summary:

### What is changed and how it works?

7 min 53s => 9.32s
(B.T.W, if we don't add error stack on decimal truncate error, the execution time can furthur reduce to 5s)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1420062/206188499-a9d9f54d-3d6d-497e-92e0-9688c3a443f5.png)


Before the change:

```
mysql> insert into t1 (c1) select * from t2;
Query OK, 491520 rows affected, 65535 warnings (7 min 53.87 sec)
Records: 491520  Duplicates: 0  Warnings: 65535
```

After:

```
mysql> insert into t1 (c1) select * from t2;
Query OK, 491520 rows affected, 65535 warnings (9.32 sec)
Records: 491520  Duplicates: 0  Warnings: 65535
```

Signed-off-by: joccau <zak.zhao@pingcap.com>

<!--

Thank you for contributing to TiDB!

PR Title Format:
1. pkg [, pkg2, pkg3]: what's changed

### What problem does this PR solve?
<!--

Please create an issue first to describe the problem.

There MUST be one line starting with "Issue Number:  " and 
linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/issues/39722

Problem Summary:
- The process of PITR restore is run with the flag `--check-requirements=false `
- PITR support batch method on the default condition, and TiKV is v6.4.0 that not support batch pitr.

### What is changed and how it works?
- Set the default value of `pitrSupportBatchKVFiles` pitr is `false`.

### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [x] Unit test
- [ ] Integration test
- [x] Manual test (add detailed scripts or steps below)

Side effects

- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more CPU
- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more Memory
- [ ] Breaking backward compatibility

### What is changed and how it works?

- The scan range defined to `[start, end)` ,  so modified some implements of sql builder
- Split scan tasks for table with int or binary primary key 

For implement detail, the PR takes some considerations with:

- The region cannot grantee its start/end key is a legal format for table row: #20727. So this PR does some works to parse a legal value of the region edges.

issue.body:
Signed-off-by: guo-shaoge <shaoge1994@163.com>

<!--

Thank you for contributing to TiDB!

PR Title Format:
1. pkg [, pkg2, pkg3]: what's changed
2. *: what's changed

-->

### What problem does this PR solve?
<!--

Please create an issue first to describe the problem.

There MUST be one line starting with "Issue Number:  " and 
linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close #34707

Problem Summary: Support dispatch copTask/batchCopTask/mppTask to **tiflash_mpp/tiflash ReadNodes**.

### What is changed and how it works?

For now, there are three types of Task that will be sent to TiFlash. We need to consider all three code paths in two dimension:
1. **Dispatch**: make sure task will only be dispatched to **tiflash_mpp/ReadNode** using consistent hashing.
2. **ErrorHandling**: make sure tiflash_mpp store addr cache is updated when error occurs.

Function changes for each task type of each dimension is as following:
1. copTask:
  1.1. **Dispatch**: [choose tiflash_mpp store when get grpcCtx(in client-go)](https://github.com/tikv/client-go/pull/481/files#diff-0c36d07fbd1fc71c850ff57d323fe12bdf7f2c053ef71b7fec5bb44358f1070dR866).
  1.2. **ErrorHandling**: [onSendFail() in client-go](https://github.com/tikv/client-go/pull/481/files#diff-0c36d07fbd1fc71c850ff57d323fe12bdf7f2c053ef71b7fec5bb44358f1070dR1284).
3. batchCopTask
  2.1. **Dispatch**:  [(*CopClient) sendBatch()](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/pull/33535/files#diff-dec6808c7659579faf2c9c6f9d8b7a7e0d7095b61b9a07cfd2cbc9546a3c7c86R774). Add new storeType parameter.
  2.2. **ErrorHandling**:  [(ss *RegionBatchRequestSender) onSendFailForBatchRegions](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/pull/33535/files#diff-b7e053af55748918c6b51e58c3c4d51e6dd68f7ba3ca915422a5d72d17a71107R102)
4. mppTask
  3.1. **Dispatch**: [(c *MPPClient) ConstructMPPTasks](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/pull/33535/files#diff-3300ba3ff9760189bb4bc2021506c6fe94907d2912cae13a704cf101d2236067R86).
  3.2. **ErrorHandling**: [dispatch mppTask failed](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/pull/33535/files#diff-3300ba3ff9760189bb4bc2021506c6fe94907d2912cae13a704cf101d2236067R309) and [establish mppTask failed](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/pull/33535/files#diff-3300ba3ff9760189bb4bc2021506c6fe94907d2912cae13a704cf101d2236067R382).

A new storeType `kv.TiFlashMPP` is added to help distinguish whether task will only be **dispatch** to ReadNodes or not.
### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [ ] Unit test
- [x] Integration test: 
      1. test-infra E2E case is added: https://github.com/pingcap/endless/pull/657
      2. sqllogic test: https://github.com/pingcap/schrodinger-test/pull/484
- [ ] Manual test (add detailed scripts or steps below)
- [ ] No code

Side effects

- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more CPU
- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more Memory
- [ ] Breaking backward compatibility

Documentation

- [x] Affects user behaviors: `tiflash_mpp` is permited for **tidb_isolation_read_engines**.
- [ ] Contains syntax changes
- [ ] Contains variable changes
- [ ] Contains experimental features
- [ ] Changes MySQL compatibility

### Release note

<!-- bugfix or new feature needs a release note -->

```release-note
*: support disaggregated tiflash
```

Problem Summary:

### What is changed and how it works?

TransactionCtx is reset every time, so the `shardRand` is re-allocated everytime.
https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/2ca37cb156f95d0d70575ab66b886822efa1e5bd/sessionctx/variable/session.go#L249-L252

cd session;

vs
BenchmarkAutoIncrement-16    	  186334	    118309 ns/op	   35175 B/op	     426 allocs/op
```




Before the change:


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1420062/205850214-5d2154b8-6bbf-476f-8beb-eb1d6e6d7241.png)


After the change:

issue.body:
Signed-off-by: joccau <zak.zhao@pingcap.com>

<!--

Thank you for contributing to TiDB!

PR Title Format:
1. pkg [, pkg2, pkg3]: what's changed
2. *: what's changed

-->

### What problem does this PR solve?
<!--

Please create an issue first to describe the problem.

There MUST be one line starting with "Issue Number:  " and 
linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/issues/39602

Problem Summary:
The restoring data is gc when pitr. because the process of applying kv-events is concurrent and the kv-events is not sorted by tso.

### What is changed and how it works?
- Disable gc when pitr by set config tikv `gc.ratio-threshold`= -1.0

### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [x] Unit test
- [ ] Integration test
- [x] Manual test (add detailed scripts or steps below)
- [ ] No code

### Manual tesst
1. During PITR 
```
MySQL [(none)]> show config where name = 'gc.ratio-threshold';
+------+-------------------+--------------------+-------+
| Type | Instance          | Name               | Value |
+------+-------------------+--------------------+-------+
| tikv | 172.16.6.47:13460 | gc.ratio-threshold | -1    |
| tikv | 172.16.6.35:3460  | gc.ratio-threshold | -1    |
| tikv | 172.16.6.35:13460 | gc.ratio-threshold | -1    |
| tikv | 172.16.6.46:13460 | gc.ratio-threshold | -1    |
| tikv | 172.16.6.46:3460  | gc.ratio-threshold | -1    |
| tikv | 172.16.6.47:3460  | gc.ratio-threshold | -1    |
+------+-------------------+--------------------+-------+
```
2. finish PITR
```
MySQL [(none)]> show config where name = 'gc.ratio-threshold';
+------+-------------------+--------------------+-------+
| Type | Instance          | Name               | Value |
+------+-------------------+--------------------+-------+
| tikv | 172.16.6.47:3460  | gc.ratio-threshold | 1.1   |
| tikv | 172.16.6.47:13460 | gc.ratio-threshold | 1.1   |
| tikv | 172.16.6.35:3460  | gc.ratio-threshold | 1.1   |
| tikv | 172.16.6.35:13460 | gc.ratio-threshold | 1.1   |
| tikv | 172.16.6.46:13460 | gc.ratio-threshold | 1.1   |
| tikv | 172.16.6.46:3460  | gc.ratio-threshold | 1.1   |
+------+-------------------+--------------------+-------+
```
3.  admin check table after PITR finished
```
MySQL [(none)]> admin check table flashback.user_data1;
Query OK, 0 rows affected (1.61 sec)
```

Side effects

- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more CPU
- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more Memory
- [ ] Breaking backward compatibility

Documentation

- [ ] Affects user behaviors
- [ ] Contains syntax changes
- [ ] Contains variable changes
- [ ] Contains experimental features
- [ ] Changes MySQL compatibility

### Release note

<!-- compatibility change, improvement, bugfix, and new feature need a release note -->

Please refer to [Release Notes Language Style Guide](https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/release-notes-style-guide.html) to write a quality release note.

```release-note
Disable GC when restore log(PITR) and Enable GC when finish PITR.
```

What's Changed:

<!--

You could use "commit message" code block to add more description to the final commit message.
For more info, check https://github.com/tikv/tikv/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#format-of-the-commit-message.

-->
```commit-message
Update lock wait info after acquiring locks, so that in case there is resumable pessimistic lock requests that's waiting in TiKV, the latest waiting relationship can be used to provide the diagnostic information and do deadlock detection.
```

issue.body:
Signed-off-by: hillium <yu745514916@live.com>

<!--

Thank you for contributing to TiDB!

PR Title Format:
1. pkg [, pkg2, pkg3]: what's changed
2. *: what's changed

-->

### What problem does this PR solve?
<!--

Please create an issue first to describe the problem.

There MUST be one line starting with "Issue Number:  " and 
linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close #39688 

Problem Summary:
We clear the subscription error before canceling the subscription, once there are some errors emitted during canceling, there would be a error-retry loop.

### What is changed and how it works?
This PR:
- Make subscriptions don't emit error when meeting `Status(codes.Canceled, _)`.
- Clear the error after canceling current subscription.

### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [x] Unit test

### Release note

<!-- compatibility change, improvement, bugfix, and new feature need a release note -->

Please refer to [Release Notes Language Style Guide](https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/release-notes-style-guide.html) to write a quality release note.

```release-note
Fixed a bug that may cause TiDB send unexpected unnecessary requests to TiKV.
```

<!--

linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close #39723

Problem Summary:

I made the wrong assumption on the arguments of `TryGetHandleRestoredDataWrapper`. 

Actually, the `row []types.Datum` must have the length of all columns in a table.

### What is changed and how it works?

- Refactor `TryGetHandleRestoredDataWrapper` and correct the usage.
- Add a recover function to prevent TiDB exiting directly on error.
- Add two integration tests.

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close #39692

Problem Summary:


### What is changed and how it works?
Fix integration test cases with `--with-sys-table`.

### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [x] Unit test
- [x] Integration test
- [x] Manual test (add detailed scripts or steps below)
- [ ] No code

Side effects

- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more CPU
- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more Memory
- [ ] Breaking backward compatibility

Documentation

- [ ] Affects user behaviors
- [ ] Contains syntax changes
- [ ] Contains variable changes
- [ ] Contains experimental features
- [ ] Changes MySQL compatibility

### Manual test
case 1:
- br backup full
- In restore cluster, execute `alter table mysql.user add column xx int;`
- br restore full
- success

case 2:
- In backup cluster, execute `alter table mysql.user add column xx int;`
- br backup full
- br restore full
- failed, `Error: missing column in cluster data, table: user, col: xx int(11): [BR:Restore:ErrRestoreIncompatibleSys]incompatible system table`

- Fix https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/issues/39644: Update the cache

For more info, check https://github.com/tikv/tikv/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#format-of-the-commit-message.

-->
```commit-message
Update lock wait info after acquiring locks, so that in case there is resumable pessimistic lock requests that's waiting in TiKV, the latest waiting relationship can be used to provide the diagnostic information and do deadlock detection.
```

issue.body:
Signed-off-by: hillium <yu745514916@live.com>

<!--

Thank you for contributing to TiDB!

PR Title Format:
1. pkg [, pkg2, pkg3]: what's changed
2. *: what's changed

-->

### What problem does this PR solve?
<!--

Please create an issue first to describe the problem.

There MUST be one line starting with "Issue Number:  " and 
linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/issues/39620

Problem Summary:
Sometimes, the receive stream may get stuck when TiKV goes down, and there isn't a timeout for ticking, which may lead to the advancer get stuck, blocking the checkpoint advancing.

### What is changed and how it works?
This PR added a timeout valued `10 * TICK_INTERVAL` for ticking.

### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [x] Unit test

### Release note

<!-- compatibility change, improvement, bugfix, and new feature need a release note -->

Please refer to [Release Notes Language Style Guide](https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/release-notes-style-guide.html) to write a quality release note.

```release-note
Fixed a bug that may cause log backup checkpoint cannot be advanced when some of TiKV down.
```

issue.body:
Signed-off-by: ekexium <eke@fastmail.com>

<!--

Thank you for contributing to TiDB!

PR Title Format:
1. pkg [, pkg2, pkg3]: what's changed
2. *: what's changed

-->

### What problem does this PR solve?
<!--

Please create an issue first to describe the problem.

There MUST be one line starting with "Issue Number:  " and 
linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close #39611

Problem Summary:
The sequence of events that leads to the panic is:
membuffer.set -> enlarge -> onMemChange -> memory tracker decides to panic -> deferred releasing current staging buffer in AddRecord -> revert to last checkpoint

When reverting to last checkpoint, memdb iterates over the nodes backwards, here is why it panics:
The latest block of the arena is in an intermediate state: it is just allocated but no data has been written yet. So its length is 0. While during the iteration we assume the length cannot be 0.

### What is changed and how it works?

Don't let memdb call the callback when the block is in intermediate state. Instead call it after any content is inserted after a new block is allocated.

### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [ ] Unit test
- [ ] Integration test
- [x] Manual test (add detailed scripts or steps below)
- [ ] No code

Side effects

- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more CPU
- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more Memory
- [ ] Breaking backward compatibility

Documentation

- [ ] Affects user behaviors
- [ ] Contains syntax changes
- [ ] Contains variable changes
- [ ] Contains experimental features
- [ ] Changes MySQL compatibility

<!-- compatibility change, improvement, bugfix, and new feature need a release note -->

issue.title: ttl: add info schema cache and ttl table status table cache for ttl scheduler

labels.name: status/LGT2
labels.description: Indicates that a PR has LGTM 2.

labels.name: status/can-merge
labels.description: Indicates a PR has been approved by a committer.

labels.name: size/XXL
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 1000+ lines, ignoring generated files.

issue.body:
### What problem does this PR solve?

Issue Number: close #39466

Problem Summary:

To implement a ttl job scheduler, we'll need a local map for info schema and ttl table status, to map from a physical table id to related schema information and the information stored in the ttl table status

### What is changed and how it works?

It does the following changes:

1. Refine the code structure. The sql generator and cache are split and placed in different directories. If we are using sql generator and cache from the manager, both placing them in one level and "reverse (about the folder hierarchy) dependency" is not suggested.
2. Move codes related with session into `ttl/session`, and add an interface of session pool into it (though there are some existing session pool, with the same definition here). I don't know whether it appropriate to add yet another session pool interface (but others are in extensions, br... pkg).
3. Add two struct: `InfoSchemaCache` and the `TTLTableStatusCache`. They are the local mirror of the info schema and `mysql.tidb_ttl_table_status` system table.

This PR relies on https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/pull/39315. Please merge it before this one.

### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [x] Unit test
- [x] Integration test
- [ ] Manual test (add detailed scripts or steps below)
- [ ] No code

release.name: TiFlash v6.1.3
release.body:
## Bug fixes

* Fix the issue that logical operators return wrong results when the argument type is UInt8 [#6127](https://github.com/pingcap/tiflash/issues/6127)
* Fix the issue that wrong data input for `CAST(value AS DATETIME)` causing high TiFlash sys CPU [#5097](https://github.com/pingcap/tiflash/issues/5097) @[xzhangxian1008](https://github.com/xzhangxian1008)
* Fix the issue that heavy write pressure might generate too many column files in the delta layer [#6361](https://github.com/pingcap/tiflash/issues/6361) @[lidezhu](https://github.com/lidezhu)
* Fix the issue that column files in the delta layer cannot be compacted after restarting TiFlash [#6159](https://github.com/pingcap/tiflash/issues/6159) @[lidezhu](https://github.com/lidezhu)
release.short_description_html:
Bug fixes

  • Fix the issue that logical operators return wrong results when the argument type is UInt8 #6127
  • Fix the issue that wrong data input for CAST(value AS DATETIME) causing high TiFlash sys CPU

### What problem does this PR solve?

Issue Number: ref #38928

Also merge the [PR in tidb-test](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb-test/pull/2031)

Problem Summary:

Since sysvars for password validation satisfy `length >= number_count + special_char_count + 2 * mixed_case_count`, altering the latter 3 sysvars may also alter `length`

labels.name: cherry-pick-approved
labels.description: Cherry pick PR approved by release team.

issue.body:
This is an automated cherry-pick of #6446

### What problem does this PR solve?

Issue Number: close https://github.com/pingcap/tiflash/issues/6407

Problem Summary:
In the previous version, PageStorage v2 do the in-memory version list compaction when snapshot is released. Because multiple snapshot could be released concurrently, this causes some redundant CPU/memory resources.
What's more, slow-releasing snapshots cause DeltaTree's delta-compact task running slowly. This leads to many ColumnFileTiny remain not compacted and causing OOM.

### What is changed and how it works?

Move the in-memory version list compaction to a background pool that is inited when PS v2 instances are created.

### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [ ] Unit test
- [ ] Integration test
- [x] Manual test (add detailed scripts or steps below)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4865550/206362830-86bc35e2-2c77-4a46-b59b-a7bdb57b0630.png)
- [ ] No code

Side effects

- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more CPU
- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more Memory
- [ ] Breaking backward compatibility

Documentation

- [ ] Affects user behaviors
- [ ] Contains syntax changes
- [ ] Contains variable changes
- [ ] Contains experimental features
- [ ] Changes MySQL compatibility

### Release note

<!-- bugfix or new feature needs a release note -->

```release-note
Fix an issue that causes OOM with high throughput write
```

issue.body:
<!--

Thank you for contributing to TiDB!

PR Title Format:
1. pkg [, pkg2, pkg3]: what's changed
2. *: what's changed

-->

### What problem does this PR solve?
<!--

Please create an issue first to describe the problem.

There MUST be one line starting with "Issue Number:  " and 
linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close #38938 

Problem Summary:

### What is changed and how it works?

Most of the feature is the same as MySQL's, except that:

- A server restart, accounts not reset
- Execution of FLUSH PRIVILEGES. (Starting the server with --skip-grant-tables,  failed-login tracking is working. 
    In this case, the first execution of FLUSH PRIVILEGES accounts not reset.)


### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [x] Unit test
- [ ] Integration test
- [ ] Manual test (add detailed scripts or steps below)
- [ ] No code

Side effects

- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more CPU
- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more Memory
- [ ] Breaking backward compatibility

Documentation

- [ ] Affects user behaviors
- [ ] Contains syntax changes
- [ ] Contains variable changes
- [ ] Contains experimental features
- [ ] Changes MySQL compatibility

### Release note

<!-- compatibility change, improvement, bugfix, and new feature need a release note -->

Please refer to [Release Notes Language Style Guide](https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/release-notes-style-guide.html) to write a quality release note.

```release-note

Support failed-login tracking and temporary account locking for users with `FAILED_LOGIN_ATTEMPTS` and/or `PASSWORD_LOCK_TIME`

```

<!--

Thank you for contributing to TiDB!

PR Title Format:
1. pkg [, pkg2, pkg3]: what's changed

### What problem does this PR solve?
<!--

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close #39702

Problem Summary:

### What is changed and how it works?

7 min 53s => 9.32s
(B.T.W, if we don't add error stack on decimal truncate error, the execution time can furthur reduce to 5s)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1420062/206188499-a9d9f54d-3d6d-497e-92e0-9688c3a443f5.png)


Before the change:

```
mysql> insert into t1 (c1) select * from t2;
Query OK, 491520 rows affected, 65535 warnings (7 min 53.87 sec)
Records: 491520  Duplicates: 0  Warnings: 65535
```

After:

```
mysql> insert into t1 (c1) select * from t2;
Query OK, 491520 rows affected, 65535 warnings (9.32 sec)
Records: 491520  Duplicates: 0  Warnings: 65535
```

### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

Signed-off-by: joccau <zak.zhao@pingcap.com>

Issue Number: close https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/issues/39722

Problem Summary:
- The process of PITR restore is run with the flag `--check-requirements=false `
- PITR support batch method on the default condition, and TiKV is v6.4.0 that not support batch pitr.

Issue Number: close #39626

### What is changed and how it works?

- The scan range defined to `[start, end)` ,  so modified some implements of sql builder
- Split scan tasks for table with int or binary primary key 

For implement detail, the PR takes some considerations with:

- The region cannot grantee its start/end key is a legal format for table row: #20727. So this PR does some works to parse a legal value of the region edges.
- When a int handle is unsigned, and if a range  is across negative and positive values, we should split this range to two ranges.

issue.body:
Signed-off-by: guo-shaoge <shaoge1994@163.com>

<!--

Thank you for contributing to TiDB!

PR Title Format:
1. pkg [, pkg2, pkg3]: what's changed
2. *: what's changed

-->

### What problem does this PR solve?
<!--

Please create an issue first to describe the problem.

There MUST be one line starting with "Issue Number:  " and 
linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close #34707

Problem Summary: Support dispatch copTask/batchCopTask/mppTask to **tiflash_mpp/tiflash ReadNodes**.

### What is changed and how it works?

For now, there are three types of Task that will be sent to TiFlash. We need to consider all three code paths in two dimension:
1. **Dispatch**: make sure task will only be dispatched to **tiflash_mpp/ReadNode** using consistent hashing.
2. **ErrorHandling**: make sure tiflash_mpp store addr cache is updated when error occurs.

Function changes for each task type of each dimension is as following:
1. copTask:
  1.1. **Dispatch**: [choose tiflash_mpp store when get grpcCtx(in client-go)](https://github.com/tikv/client-go/pull/481/files#diff-0c36d07fbd1fc71c850ff57d323fe12bdf7f2c053ef71b7fec5bb44358f1070dR866).
  1.2. **ErrorHandling**: [onSendFail() in client-go](https://github.com/tikv/client-go/pull/481/files#diff-0c36d07fbd1fc71c850ff57d323fe12bdf7f2c053ef71b7fec5bb44358f1070dR1284).
3. batchCopTask
  2.1. **Dispatch**:  [(*CopClient) sendBatch()](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/pull/33535/files#diff-dec6808c7659579faf2c9c6f9d8b7a7e0d7095b61b9a07cfd2cbc9546a3c7c86R774). Add new storeType parameter.
  2.2. **ErrorHandling**:  [(ss *RegionBatchRequestSender) onSendFailForBatchRegions](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/pull/33535/files#diff-b7e053af55748918c6b51e58c3c4d51e6dd68f7ba3ca915422a5d72d17a71107R102)
4. mppTask
  3.1. **Dispatch**: [(c *MPPClient) ConstructMPPTasks](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/pull/33535/files#diff-3300ba3ff9760189bb4bc2021506c6fe94907d2912cae13a704cf101d2236067R86).
  3.2. **ErrorHandling**: [dispatch mppTask failed](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/pull/33535/files#diff-3300ba3ff9760189bb4bc2021506c6fe94907d2912cae13a704cf101d2236067R309) and [establish mppTask failed](https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/pull/33535/files#diff-3300ba3ff9760189bb4bc2021506c6fe94907d2912cae13a704cf101d2236067R382).

A new storeType `kv.TiFlashMPP` is added to help distinguish whether task will only be **dispatch** to ReadNodes or not.
### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [ ] Unit test
- [x] Integration test: 
      1. test-infra E2E case is added: https://github.com/pingcap/endless/pull/657
      2. sqllogic test: https://github.com/pingcap/schrodinger-test/pull/484
- [ ] Manual test (add detailed scripts or steps below)
- [ ] No code

Side effects

- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more CPU
- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more Memory
- [ ] Breaking backward compatibility

Documentation

- [x] Affects user behaviors: `tiflash_mpp` is permited for **tidb_isolation_read_engines**.
- [ ] Contains syntax changes
- [ ] Contains variable changes
- [ ] Contains experimental features
- [ ] Changes MySQL compatibility

### Release note

<!-- bugfix or new feature needs a release note -->

```release-note
*: support disaggregated tiflash
```

Problem Summary:

### What is changed and how it works?

TransactionCtx is reset every time, so the `shardRand` is re-allocated everytime.
https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/blob/2ca37cb156f95d0d70575ab66b886822efa1e5bd/sessionctx/variable/session.go#L249-L252

cd session;

vs
BenchmarkAutoIncrement-16    	  186334	    118309 ns/op	   35175 B/op	     426 allocs/op

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1420062/205850214-5d2154b8-6bbf-476f-8beb-eb1d6e6d7241.png)

issue.body:
Signed-off-by: joccau <zak.zhao@pingcap.com>

<!--

Thank you for contributing to TiDB!

PR Title Format:
1. pkg [, pkg2, pkg3]: what's changed
2. *: what's changed

-->

### What problem does this PR solve?
<!--

Please create an issue first to describe the problem.

There MUST be one line starting with "Issue Number:  " and 
linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/issues/39602

Problem Summary:
The restoring data is gc when pitr. because the process of applying kv-events is concurrent and the kv-events is not sorted by tso.

### What is changed and how it works?
- Disable gc when pitr by set config tikv `gc.ratio-threshold`= -1.0

### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [x] Unit test
- [ ] Integration test
- [x] Manual test (add detailed scripts or steps below)
- [ ] No code

### Manual tesst
1. During PITR 
```
MySQL [(none)]> show config where name = 'gc.ratio-threshold';
+------+-------------------+--------------------+-------+
| Type | Instance          | Name               | Value |
+------+-------------------+--------------------+-------+
| tikv | 172.16.6.47:13460 | gc.ratio-threshold | -1    |
| tikv | 172.16.6.35:3460  | gc.ratio-threshold | -1    |
| tikv | 172.16.6.35:13460 | gc.ratio-threshold | -1    |
| tikv | 172.16.6.46:13460 | gc.ratio-threshold | -1    |
| tikv | 172.16.6.46:3460  | gc.ratio-threshold | -1    |
| tikv | 172.16.6.47:3460  | gc.ratio-threshold | -1    |
+------+-------------------+--------------------+-------+
```
2. finish PITR
```
MySQL [(none)]> show config where name = 'gc.ratio-threshold';
+------+-------------------+--------------------+-------+
| Type | Instance          | Name               | Value |
+------+-------------------+--------------------+-------+
| tikv | 172.16.6.47:3460  | gc.ratio-threshold | 1.1   |
| tikv | 172.16.6.47:13460 | gc.ratio-threshold | 1.1   |
| tikv | 172.16.6.35:3460  | gc.ratio-threshold | 1.1   |
| tikv | 172.16.6.35:13460 | gc.ratio-threshold | 1.1   |
| tikv | 172.16.6.46:13460 | gc.ratio-threshold | 1.1   |
| tikv | 172.16.6.46:3460  | gc.ratio-threshold | 1.1   |
+------+-------------------+--------------------+-------+
```
3.  admin check table after PITR finished
```
MySQL [(none)]> admin check table flashback.user_data1;
Query OK, 0 rows affected (1.61 sec)
```

Side effects

- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more CPU
- [ ] Performance regression: Consumes more Memory
- [ ] Breaking backward compatibility

Documentation

- [ ] Affects user behaviors
- [ ] Contains syntax changes
- [ ] Contains variable changes
- [ ] Contains experimental features
- [ ] Changes MySQL compatibility

### Release note

<!-- compatibility change, improvement, bugfix, and new feature need a release note -->

Please refer to [Release Notes Language Style Guide](https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/release-notes-style-guide.html) to write a quality release note.

```release-note
Disable GC when restore log(PITR) and Enable GC when finish PITR.
```

What's Changed:

<!--

You could use "commit message" code block to add more description to the final commit message.
For more info, check https://github.com/tikv/tikv/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#format-of-the-commit-message.

-->
```commit-message
Update lock wait info after acquiring locks, so that in case there is resumable pessimistic lock requests that's waiting in TiKV, the latest waiting relationship can be used to provide the diagnostic information and do deadlock detection.
```

issue.body:
Signed-off-by: hillium <yu745514916@live.com>

<!--

Thank you for contributing to TiDB!

PR Title Format:
1. pkg [, pkg2, pkg3]: what's changed
2. *: what's changed

-->

### What problem does this PR solve?
<!--

Please create an issue first to describe the problem.

There MUST be one line starting with "Issue Number:  " and 
linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close #39688 

Problem Summary:
We clear the subscription error before canceling the subscription, once there are some errors emitted during canceling, there would be a error-retry loop.

### What is changed and how it works?
This PR:
- Make subscriptions don't emit error when meeting `Status(codes.Canceled, _)`.
- Clear the error after canceling current subscription.

### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [x] Unit test

### Release note

<!-- compatibility change, improvement, bugfix, and new feature need a release note -->

Please refer to [Release Notes Language Style Guide](https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/release-notes-style-guide.html) to write a quality release note.

```release-note
Fixed a bug that may cause TiDB send unexpected unnecessary requests to TiKV.
```

<!--

Thank you for contributing to TiDB!

-->

### What problem does this PR solve?
<!--

linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close #39723

Problem Summary:

I made the wrong assumption on the arguments of `TryGetHandleRestoredDataWrapper`. 

Actually, the `row []types.Datum` must have the length of all columns in a table.

### What is changed and how it works?

- Refactor `TryGetHandleRestoredDataWrapper` and correct the usage.
- Add a recover function to prevent TiDB exiting directly on error.
- Add two integration tests.

Issue Number: close #39692

Problem Summary:


### What is changed and how it works?
Fix integration test cases with `--with-sys-table`.

### Check List

- [ ] Contains experimental features

### Manual test
case 1:
- br backup full
- In restore cluster, execute `alter table mysql.user add column xx int;`
- br restore full
- success

case 2:
- In backup cluster, execute `alter table mysql.user add column xx int;`
- br backup full
- br restore full
- failed, `Error: missing column in cluster data, table: user, col: xx int(11): [BR:Restore:ErrRestoreIncompatibleSys]incompatible system table`

<!--
Thank you for contributing to TiKV!

If you haven't already, please read TiKV's [CONTRIBUTING](https://github.com/tikv/tikv/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) document.

If you're unsure about anything, just ask; somebody should be along to answer within a day or two.

PR Title Format:
1. module [, module2, module3]: what's changed
2. *: what's changed
-->

<!--

There MUST be one line starting with "Issue Number:  " and 
linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://github.com/tikv/tikv/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#linking-issues.

-->
Issue Number: Ref #13298

What's Changed:

<!--

You could use "commit message" code block to add more description to the final commit message.
For more info, check https://github.com/tikv/tikv/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#format-of-the-commit-message.

-->
```commit-message
Update lock wait info after acquiring locks, so that in case there is resumable pessimistic lock requests that's waiting in TiKV, the latest waiting relationship can be used to provide the diagnostic information and do deadlock detection.
```

### Related changes

\-

### Check List <!--REMOVE the items that are not applicable-->

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- Unit test
- Integration test

Side effects

- Performance regression

    - Consumes more MEM

```

issue.body:
Signed-off-by: hillium <yu745514916@live.com>

<!--

Thank you for contributing to TiDB!

PR Title Format:
1. pkg [, pkg2, pkg3]: what's changed
2. *: what's changed

-->

### What problem does this PR solve?
<!--

Please create an issue first to describe the problem.

There MUST be one line starting with "Issue Number:  " and 
linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/issues/39620

Problem Summary:
Sometimes, the receive stream may get stuck when TiKV goes down, and there isn't a timeout for ticking, which may lead to the advancer get stuck, blocking the checkpoint advancing.

### What is changed and how it works?
This PR added a timeout valued `10 * TICK_INTERVAL` for ticking.

### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [x] Unit test

### Release note

<!-- compatibility change, improvement, bugfix, and new feature need a release note -->

Please refer to [Release Notes Language Style Guide](https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/release-notes-style-guide.html) to write a quality release note.

```release-note
Fixed a bug that may cause log backup checkpoint cannot be advanced when some of TiKV down.
```

issue.body:
Signed-off-by: ekexium <eke@fastmail.com>

<!--

Thank you for contributing to TiDB!

PR Title Format:
1. pkg [, pkg2, pkg3]: what's changed
2. *: what's changed

-->

### What problem does this PR solve?
<!--

Please create an issue first to describe the problem.

There MUST be one line starting with "Issue Number:  " and 
linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://pingcap.github.io/tidb-dev-guide/contribute-to-tidb/contribute-code.html#referring-to-an-issue.

-->

Issue Number: close #39611

Problem Summary:
The sequence of events that leads to the panic is:
membuffer.set -> enlarge -> onMemChange -> memory tracker decides to panic -> deferred releasing current staging buffer in AddRecord -> revert to last checkpoint

When reverting to last checkpoint, memdb iterates over the nodes backwards, here is why it panics:
The latest block of the arena is in an intermediate state: it is just allocated but no data has been written yet. So its length is 0. While during the iteration we assume the length cannot be 0.

### What is changed and how it works?

Don't let memdb call the callback when the block is in intermediate state. Instead call it after any content is inserted after a new block is allocated.

issue.title: ttl: add info schema cache and ttl table status table cache for ttl scheduler

labels.name: status/LGT2
labels.description: Indicates that a PR has LGTM 2.

labels.name: status/can-merge
labels.description: Indicates a PR has been approved by a committer.

labels.name: size/XXL
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 1000+ lines, ignoring generated files.

issue.body:
### What problem does this PR solve?

Issue Number: close #39466

Problem Summary:

To implement a ttl job scheduler, we'll need a local map for info schema and ttl table status, to map from a physical table id to related schema information and the information stored in the ttl table status

### What is changed and how it works?

It does the following changes:

1. Refine the code structure. The sql generator and cache are split and placed in different directories. If we are using sql generator and cache from the manager, both placing them in one level and "reverse (about the folder hierarchy) dependency" is not suggested.
2. Move codes related with session into `ttl/session`, and add an interface of session pool into it (though there are some existing session pool, with the same definition here). I don't know whether it appropriate to add yet another session pool interface (but others are in extensions, br... pkg).
3. Add two struct: `InfoSchemaCache` and the `TTLTableStatusCache`. They are the local mirror of the info schema and `mysql.tidb_ttl_table_status` system table.

This PR relies on https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/pull/39315. Please merge it before this one.

### Check List

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- [x] Unit test
- [x] Integration test
- [ ] Manual test (add detailed scripts or steps below)
- [ ] No code

release.name: TiFlash v6.1.3
release.body:
## Bug fixes

* Fix the issue that logical operators return wrong results when the argument type is UInt8 [#6127](https://github.com/pingcap/tiflash/issues/6127)
* Fix the issue that wrong data input for `CAST(value AS DATETIME)` causing high TiFlash sys CPU [#5097](https://github.com/pingcap/tiflash/issues/5097) @[xzhangxian1008](https://github.com/xzhangxian1008)
* Fix the issue that heavy write pressure might generate too many column files in the delta layer [#6361](https://github.com/pingcap/tiflash/issues/6361) @[lidezhu](https://github.com/lidezhu)
* Fix the issue that column files in the delta layer cannot be compacted after restarting TiFlash [#6159](https://github.com/pingcap/tiflash/issues/6159) @[lidezhu](https://github.com/lidezhu)
release.short_description_html:
Bug fixes

  • Fix the issue that logical operators return wrong results when the argument type is UInt8 #6127
  • Fix the issue that wrong data input for CAST(value AS DATETIME) causing high TiFlash sys CPU

Issue Number: close https://github.com/pingcap/tidb/issues/39575

Problem Summary:
- Failed to unmarsher short-value into DbInfo because the meta-kv is `rollback` record.

### What is changed and how it works?
- Skip rewrite value if the meta-kv is `rollback` record.
